page.title: 06PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport on the roads throughout the study area is very limited.The{A27}to the South has three main services.A South Coast service runs between{Portsmouth}and {Brighton}whilst two local buses connect{Emsworth with Chichester}and {Selsey}and{Bosham}with{Chichester. } The village of{West Ashling}has only two buses a week, travelling to Chichester.To the North of the area regular services connect Chichester with outlying villages and Chichester with Westbourne. The{British Rail}stations at{Bosham} and{Fishbourne}lie just North of the {A27}road.Regular services run between Portsmouth and London and link the South Coast towns e.g. Brighton, Southampton.The line is electrified. Ownership of a car-especially in the isolated areas would appear essential.
